name: Charles Tallent
text: Awesome. Rob's inshore fishing is always productive. A Navy veteran with lots of experience to put you on the best fishing.

name: Mort Lane
text: Great fishing trip have used Rob in the past never disappointed professional and knowledgeable.

name: kgbcolo
text: Hands down the best snow crab legs we’ve been able to find since moving to Bham in 2012! Sweet, firm and absolutely delicious! Reasonably priced, packed them in ice for us to get home and provided a box as well. Great customer service, will be using Hoover Seafood Market again and recommending them to others!

name: David Sanders
text: This is the only place I buy seafood now, if you haven’t been, you definitely need to. For quality of product, it literally can’t be beat!  They get everything in fresh, they steam it for you if you want, and their crawfish brine is TO DIE FOR!  They also sell the brine for you to cook on your own at home if you’d rather. They have all the spices to do Cajun right, and the staff couldn’t be more helpful or knowledgeable. Joe is always at the counter and you’ll never meet anyone who knows more about seafood. I can’t rave about this place enough, it’s clean, convenient, and better freshness and quality of seafood in Birmingham, you’ll never find!

name: P F (Passiflora)
text:
Fresh Gulf seafood!
Visited today for the first time. Got fast, friendly service, fresh gulf oysters, ready-to-cook crab cakes. Fish custom filleted in the back while I waited. They even gave me samples of freshly cooked fish and oysters.

name: Stacey Brown
text:
I decided to shop local instead of Whole Foods on hwy 280 in search for whole red snapper. They did have red snapper and was able to prepare it for cooking just as Whole Foods does. Their prices are higher than Whole Foods which wasn't a deal breaker. We purchased 2 whole red snapper at $52.61 and a half of filet of Salmon at $27.13. They politely provided ice for the ride as requested. Before we could get home we started smelling a foul smell from the fish. This has never happened on our ride from Whole Foods which is a farther distance. We are not fish experts by any means- just seafood lovers. Anyone who does fish would know that one of the fish that we were sold was spoiled and should not be eaten. Definitely an owner or employee of a seafood market would know this. I did some research to determine the signs of bad fish (Spoiled fish has an unpleasant, sharp smell of trimethylamine (bad fish) and rot. Eyes of fresh fish are bulging and shiny. Eyes of old fish are cloudy and sunken into the head. Gills and fins of fresh fish are moist).
One of our fish had all of the signs listed (I posted pictures of the two snappers we were sold).
So what was meant for dinner for two is now dinner for one for @ $52.61.
This was my first and last experience at the Hoover Seafood Market.

name: Byrdman Byrdman
text: They had a item that I had been looking for about a Month now, I paid roughly about  75$ more than I usually pay for them . The quality of the product that I purchased  I would pay that 219.00 again

name: Becky Brown
text: Best seafood this side of the Mississippi. Not only did they steam it for us, but gave us samples and taught us how to eat the crawfish.

name: myPRbyValerie Saunders
text: They have a variety of fresh seafood, friendly staff, and great prices! Would definately recommend to seafood lovers!

name: Cody Bridges
text: Seafood gumbo is on on point. Rich flavor and boucoup crabmeat! Boiled crawfish is also great, plenty of spice but not over salted. I’m from south Louisiana and this is Cajun certified 👌🏼!!!

name: Victoria Fitzgerald
text: My husband bought my Mother’s Day Dinner Seafood extravaganza from them and everything was amazing! The lobster tails were the perfect size and sweet, the shrimp were huge, the scallops were great and the lump crab meat was tasty. There was so much I couldn’t eat it all so we’re going to make a cream of crab soup to keep this experience going! Thanks for providing such high quality products during a pandemic and bringing a bright spot into my weekend!

name: Hannah Pennington
text: The best fresh seafood you will find! My kids look forward to going to visit Mr. Joe and draw on his chalk boards, and ooh and ahh over his fishing and hunting photos.  Just an all around great man,  with amazing customer service and superb mud bugs, shrimp, crab meat, and more!

name: Ramona Graffeo
text: They always have fresh seafood. Never a bad experience. V friendly staff ❣️

name: Adreinne Bonar
text: Got crablegs awesome service! Very tasty crab!! Will definitely visit again!

name: Sam
text: Great new spot for FRESH seafood in Hoover!!  I had a hard time narrowing down the options, as the Red Snapper, Black Grouper, Seabass, and Royal Red shrimp all looked amazing.  Joe(owner) was happy to filet a fresh piece of Triggerfish.  I will make this a regular spot to grab seafood on the way home!

name: Gregg Janowski
text: Very fresh seafood with a good variety.

name: Four Wheeln
text: Picked up some Crawfish there and loved it
